title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu Mar 29, 2018 | 9:35am   29 
A protester wearing a "Black Lives Matter" earring chants slogans as she marches in Times Square in Manhattan during a protest against the death of Stephon Clark in Sacramento, California. REUTERS/Gabriela Bhaskar Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 A protester wearing a "Black Lives Matter" earring chants slogans as she marches in Times Square in Manhattan during a protest against the death of Stephon Clark in Sacramento, California. REUTERS/Gabriela Bhaskar Close 2 / 29 
Reacquired Volkswagen and Audi diesel cars sit in a desert graveyard near Victorville, California. Volkswagen AG has paid more than $7.4 billion to buy back about 350,000 vehicles, the automaker said in a recent court filing, and is now storing... more Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 Reacquired Volkswagen and Audi diesel cars sit in a desert graveyard near Victorville, California. Volkswagen AG has paid more than $7.4 billion to buy back about 350,000 vehicles, the automaker said in a recent court filing, and is now storing thousands of vehicles around the United States. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson Close 3 / 29 
Relatives of inmates held at the General Command of the Carabobo Police react as they wait outside the prison, where a fire occurred in the cells area, according to local media, in Valencia, Venezuela. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Relatives of inmates held at the General Command of the Carabobo Police react as they wait outside the prison, where a fire occurred in the cells area, according to local media, in Valencia, Venezuela. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins Close 4 / 29 
Pope Francis leads the Chrism Mass on Holy Thursday during which sacred oils are blessed at�Saint�Peter's�Basilica�at the Vatican. REUTERS/Stefano Rellandini Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 Pope Francis leads the Chrism Mass on Holy Thursday during which sacred oils are blessed at�Saint�Peter's�Basilica�at the Vatican. REUTERS/Stefano Rellandini Close 5 / 29 
A fisherman walks on the ice-covered Dnipro River during a snowfall in Kiev, Ukraine. REUTERS/Valentyn Ogirenko Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 A fisherman walks on the ice-covered Dnipro River during a snowfall in Kiev, Ukraine. REUTERS/Valentyn Ogirenko Close 6 / 29 
Balloons fly after being released by people who gather to commemorate the victims of a shopping mall fire in Kemerovo on the day of national mourning in Russia, in Minsk, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Balloons fly after being released by people who gather to commemorate the victims of a shopping mall fire in Kemerovo on the day of national mourning in Russia, in Minsk, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Close 7 / 29 
An Ethiopian girl carries water at the Somare refugee camp on the Ethiopian-Kenyan border near the town of Moyale, Kenya. REUTERS/Baz Ratner Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 An Ethiopian girl carries water at the Somare refugee camp on the Ethiopian-Kenyan border near the town of Moyale, Kenya. REUTERS/Baz Ratner Close 8 / 29 
Freya Gordon, aged 10, poses for a photograph with a butterfly during an event to launch the Sensational Butterflies exhibition at the Natural History Museum in London. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Freya Gordon, aged 10, poses for a photograph with a butterfly during an event to launch the Sensational Butterflies exhibition at the Natural History Museum in London. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Close 9 / 29 
A general view of the re-enactment of the battle of Canchas Blancas (white fields) between Chile and Bolivia during the 1879 Pacific War, in Canchas Blancas, Potosi, Bolivia. REUTERS/David Mercado Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 A general view of the re-enactment of the battle of Canchas Blancas (white fields) between Chile and Bolivia during the 1879 Pacific War, in Canchas Blancas, Potosi, Bolivia. REUTERS/David Mercado Close 10 / 29 
  11 / 29 
A woman reacts during a funeral of a victim of a shopping mall fire at a cemetery in Kemerovo, Russia. REUTERS/Maxim Lisov Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 A woman reacts during a funeral of a victim of a shopping mall fire at a cemetery in Kemerovo, Russia. REUTERS/Maxim Lisov Close 12 / 29 
A Palestinian shouts during clashes along the Israel border with Gaza ahead of a protest in a tent city, demanding to return to their homeland, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 A Palestinian shouts during clashes along the Israel border with Gaza ahead of a protest in a tent city, demanding to return to their homeland, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close 13 / 29 
Spanish legionnaires carry a statue of the Christ of Mena outside a church during a ceremony ahead of the Mena brotherhood procession during Holy Week, in Malaga, Spain. REUTERS/Jon Nazca Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 Spanish legionnaires carry a statue of the Christ of Mena outside a church during a ceremony ahead of the Mena brotherhood procession during Holy Week, in Malaga, Spain. REUTERS/Jon Nazca Close 14 / 29 
A basketball-playing robot called CUE, developed by Toyota engineers, shoots a free throw during a rehearsal for half-time show of Alvark Tokyo's basketball match in Tokyo. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 A basketball-playing robot called CUE, developed by Toyota engineers, shoots a free throw during a rehearsal for half-time show of Alvark Tokyo's basketball match in Tokyo. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Close 15 / 29 
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and Chinese President Xi Jinping shake hands at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. Ju Peng/Xinhua via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and Chinese President Xi Jinping shake hands at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. Ju Peng/Xinhua via REUTERS Close 16 / 29 
  17 / 29 
The 2019 Nissan Altima sits covered before being presented at the New York Auto Show in Manhattan. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 The 2019 Nissan Altima sits covered before being presented at the New York Auto Show in Manhattan. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid Close 18 / 29 
  
A General Electric (GE.N) Propulsion Test Platform plane takes off near Victorville, California. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson Reuters / Thursday, March 29, 2018 A General Electric (GE.N) Propulsion Test Platform plane takes off near Victorville, California. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson Close 20 / 29 
  21 / 29 
  22 / 29 
Anti-Brexit demonstrators waving EU and Union flags are reflected in a puddle in front of the Houses of Parliament in London. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Anti-Brexit demonstrators waving EU and Union flags are reflected in a puddle in front of the Houses of Parliament in London. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 23 / 29 
France's president Emmanuel Macron attends a meeting with President and Chief Strategy Officer of Samsung Electronics Young Sohn, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. Francois Mori/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 France's president Emmanuel Macron attends a meeting with President and Chief Strategy Officer of Samsung Electronics Young Sohn, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. Francois Mori/Pool via Reuters Close 24 / 29 
A pin with a portrait of Mireille Knoll is seen on a man's jacket during a gathering, in Paris. Mireille Knoll, 85, was found dead with 11 stab wounds at her apartment in a working-class district of Paris on Friday. The apartment was set ablaze after... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 A pin with a portrait of Mireille Knoll is seen on a man's jacket during a gathering, in Paris. Mireille Knoll, 85, was found dead with 11 stab wounds at her apartment in a working-class district of Paris on Friday. The apartment was set ablaze after the attack and her body badly burnt. Police suspect that Knoll's Jewish religion was a motive for the killing. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes Close 25 / 29 
Detained Reuters journalist Wa Lone is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Detained Reuters journalist Wa Lone is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Close 26 / 29 
South Korean Unification Minister Cho Myoung-gyon and his North Korean counterpart Ri Son Gwon pose for photographs before their meeting at the truce village of Panmunjom, North Korea. Korea Pool/Yonhap via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 South Korean Unification Minister Cho Myoung-gyon and his North Korean counterpart Ri Son Gwon pose for photographs before their meeting at the truce village of Panmunjom, North Korea. Korea Pool/Yonhap via REUTERS Close 27 / 29 
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un waves from a train, as he paid an unofficial visit to China, in this undated photo released by North Korea's Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) in Pyongyang. KCNA/via Reuters Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 North Korean leader Kim Jong Un waves from a train, as he paid an unofficial visit to China, in this undated photo released by North Korea's Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) in Pyongyang. KCNA/via Reuters Close 28 / 29 
Pope Francis arrives to lead the Wednesday general audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican. REUTERS/Max Rossi Reuters / Wednesday, March 28, 2018 Pope Francis arrives to lead the Wednesday general audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican. REUTERS/Max Rossi Close
